{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 17-year-old girl who has been inducing vomiting and is concerned about her weight, even though her BMI is at the 50th percentile for her age and sex. This suggests that she may have an eating disorder. The fact that she is inducing vomiting suggests bulimia nervosa, but her normal BMI rules out anorexia nervosa. However, it is possible for patients to have a history of both anorexia and bulimia. The other options do not seem to fit with the information given. Patients with eating disorders can be further sub-typed, they often do initiate treatment, and a BMI between 17–18.5 kg/m2 is more indicative of anorexia nervosa.", "answer_choice": "C"}
